body_html:
I think you also need: libcudnn7-dev_7.0.3.11-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb to get access to cudnn.h

Although I'm not sure if using files from a deb package on a rhel system is the best idea. I'm guessing after this problem, you'll have problems with CUDA.

You can download a cuDNN .tar.gz for non-ubuntu systems from nvidia if you register with them: https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn

Is it possible to build within a docker container? Do you have docker and nvidia-docker installed ? You can run an ubuntu docker container on your rhel host with all the cuda pre-preqs pre-installed. https://hub.docker.com/r/nvidia/cuda-ppc64le/

Or you can download a pre-built whl file for CUDA 9.0:
https://powerci.osuosl.org/job/TensorFlow_PPC64LE_GPU_Release_Build/ [New URL on 9/26]
